quoteLast: , the moon having entered her last quarter. This projectile has not arrived at its destination. It has passed by the side; but sufficiently near to be retained by the lunar attraction.
title: From the Earth to the Moon; and, Round the Moon
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteFirst: Messrs. Belfast and J.T. Maston on the 12th of December at
quoteLast: , the moon having entered her last quarter.
title: The Moon-Voyage
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteFirst: This telegram announced that on the 11th of December, at
quoteLast: , the projectile hurled by the Columbiad of Stony Hill had been perceived by Messrs. Belfast and J.T. Maston, that the bullet had deviated from its course through some unknown cause, and had not reached its goal, but had gone near enough to be retained by lunar attraction; that its rectilinear movement had been changed to a circular one, and that it was describing an elliptical orbit round the moon, and had become her satellite.
title: The Moon-Voyage
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteFirst: Not an unseemly whisper disturbed the silence. So still was it that above the cooing of the sacred pigeons on the roof of the Pump Room, far down in the valley could be heard the lowing of cows. At
quoteLast: Mr. Ripple let his monocle drop; Mr. Oboe replaced his watch; the Pump Room bell began to clang very fast; the Exquisite Mob started to climb the hill and innumerable glass goblets glittered in the sun.
title: The Passionate Elopement
author: MacKenzie, Compton, 1883-1972
